channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MS

  • Description: 1. X-2023100687 SequenceEvent: condenser coil cleaner had loose caps causing contents to leak out. DescribePack: loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: oil dry to clean up spill then picked the contaminated oil dry up. 2. X-2023100688 SequenceEvent: loose caps on jugs caused liquid to leak out DescribePack: loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: oil dry was used to soak up liquid then cleaned up oil dry. 3. X-2023100689 SequenceEvent: CONDENSOR COIL CLEANER HAD LOOSE CAPS CAUSING LIQUID TO LEAK OUT. DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: OIL DRY WAS USED TO DRY LIQUID UP THEN CLEANED UP.

item.title: Report X-2023100655
item.description:
Report X-2023100655

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was in the process of being unloaded and it fell from a pallet that was stacked high. I immediately put the package into a hazmat drum and poured Amphomag on the area of the spill. DescribePack: The package had fallen on its side and leaked out the right side of the package and onto the floor of the trailer. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I cleaned the mess from the spill immediately and asked if there were any package handlers harmed, everyone said no.

item.title: Report X-2023100565
item.description:
Report X-2023100565

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100565 SequenceEvent: Package was punctured and caused outward spillage. DescribePack: By the twist top at the top of the package, small opening is visible, possibly from a sharp object piercing it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic hazmat bag to prevent further spillage. 2. X-2023100574 SequenceEvent: Package was discovered on Belt 9 leaking from the vanline, I immediately out it in a plastic hazmat bag and then a yellow drum to prevent further spillage. DescribePack: Bottom right side of the package is a small hole that is dripping the contents outward. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package appears to have been dropped.

item.title: Report X-2023100557
item.description:
Report X-2023100557

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package appears to have been damaged by improper handling. The package appears to have been dented and therefore the inner adhesive leaked out to the outer package containing the box. DescribePack: Top was cracked and had a dent. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in a plastic bag to prevent further spillage and then placed in a hazmat drum.

item.title: Report X-2023100494
item.description:
Report X-2023100494

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-04
  • City: PEARL
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler was unloading the trailer saw wet package, called QA. QA came with a red tote placed package in the red tote took it to the designated hazmat area, did a DPR, and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The tops came off of 2 jugs and contents wasted out, White plastic jugs with top caps, weighs 1 gallon, shipper is BETCO, name of product is Versifect. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: tops were put back on and contents were removed from unload area and taken to the QA Hazmat area for processing.

item.title: Report X-2023100282
item.description:
Report X-2023100282

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to our QA area from the unload already leaking out. We immediately put the package in a drum to prevent further spillage. DescribePack: One of the four bottles had a loose cap that was not properly screwed on, the inner seal was broken. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Seal was not properly secured on bottle that spilled.

item.title: Report X-2023100348
item.description:
Report X-2023100348

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-05
  • City: GULFPORT
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived to our station already damaged/leaking. Pkg was damaged during transit. Pkg was discovered while being unloaded and was taken to our QA team. DescribePack: The lids on the bottles were not secured all the way and caused the leakage. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The pkg was quickly taken to our QA team as soon as the pkg was unloaded from the trailer it came from. Our QA team made sure to put it to the side where it would stop leaking and be out of the way from other packages.
